p: The ICP34.5-deleted HSV-1 vector was engineered to express beta-galactosidase [ 122]. Strong expression was observed in the brain and dorsal root ganglia, with only minor toxicity, which indicates that deletion of the HSV-1 neurovirulence gene eliminates neurotoxicity. However, it preserves tolerable infectivity, in order to allow dominant trans-gene expression in neural tissue [ 122]. The ICP34.5-deleted HSV-1 vector was more effective with respect to lysis in human breast cancer cells than in a mixed culture of autologous hematopoietic cells [ 123].
